message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.MM, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating a signal from noisy measurements, which is a common problem in information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), signal processing (cs.SP), multimedia (cs.MM), and statistical inference (cs.SI). The use of Gaussian mixtures and sparse Gaussian inputs also suggests a connection to topics such as clustering and compressed sensing, which are often studied in these sub-categories.
